div.p: MOTIVETYPE is an attribute affiliated with the element PMOTIVES, in WRITING PRODUCTION . It has two values, ascribed and self-identified. If the author herself named her motives for writing, they are self-identified. If her contemporaries or later scholars attributed motives to her, those are ascribed.

div.codeblock: <PMOTIVES MOTIVETYPE="ascribed">AB wrote a sequel to her ballad some years later, apparently at the request of her mother.</PMOTIVES> <PMOTIVES MOTIVETYPE="self-identified">Dorothea Primrose Campbell published by subscription, giving her full name, hoping to help the family's dire financial circumstances.</PMOTIVES>
<PMOTIVES MOTIVETYPE="self-identified">Isabella Kelly wrote a small, selective encyclopedia for the benefit of her daughters.</PMOTIVES>
